Watch it on your computer.  The video is protected so you can't watch it on the PS3.  You'll need a different video file that isn't protected or a way to bypass the protection if you want to watch it on the PS3.  Many movies are protected by Cinavia so you'll just have to deal with it and watch it on your computer.  Not much of a difference is there?

the whole Cinavia thing is impossible to bypass, my roommates and i have tried multiple ways of bypassing it, it has to do with an audio frequency that isnt picked up by human ears, and the bluray or movie you try playing wont play at all unless the frequency is there and the correct one. we tried altering the frequency and thats how we found it out it MUST be in the file to even play the video.

And yes its only a SONY thing so if you encounter that issue just watch it on your computer without any issues.

@cinavia hahaha from wikipedia: "When media with the watermark is played back on a system with Cinavia detection, its firmware will detect the watermark and check that the device on which it is being played is authorized for that watermark. "

So in other words this is just waiting for the first person to make the effort to detect said watermark in software, and subsequently remove it or destroy it so it can't be detected anymore. Brilliant. I should get in the business of selling content protection mechanisms to the film industry they'll fall for anything...

duguis - Personally I think if the uploader is advertising their content as "R5 Full Line" then I would expect no less than DVD quality video and sound. If I wasted my bandwidth downloading content from someone who has advertised it incorrectly then I would also be upset. 

Thankfully I don't have a bandwidth cap so its not a massive issue, plus I get all my movies from Usenet servers anyway so generally they download at a much faster rate than torrents.

Who cares that its free? I wouldn't have an issue if they didn't advertise it as one thing, then when it's downloaded you actually find out its something completely different.

This is what the comments section is for. It's meant for other people to leave comments on the quality of the content they are downloading. Its only personal opinion so you should never criticise someone for that opinion.

#mytwocents
